page.title: 19POLICING : LAVENHAM
page.content: There is no Police Station in Lavenham but law and order is maintained by a village policeman living in a police house. He patrols on foot or by bicycle. His first priority is protec- tion of life followed by security of property. If an arrest is made the suspect is detained in the Police House until his transfer to the Police Station in Sud- bury, where there is also a Magis- trate's Court. An important factor is the help given by the policeman's wife, acting as receptionist to complainants and dis- tressed people. The duties of the community policeman include attending Parish Council Meetings. He also assists with the local Youth Club.
